items.description: Replace monthly-to-daily forward-fill with cubic spline interpolation or dual-frequency approach. Alternatively, compute daily change signals from monthly latent outputs (e.g., distance to next regime transition, days since last change).
items.reason: Gate 1/2 PASS, Gate 3 FAIL. MI increase is 23.8% (information exists) but MAE degrades in ALL 5 CV folds. The step-function from forward-fill is the primary cause. Smoothing or transforming the output should preserve MI while reducing MAE penalty.

specific_changes.output_smoothing: Cubic spline interpolation between monthly values
specific_changes.alternative: First-difference of monthly values, forward-filled (captures regime changes as pulses rather than steps)
specific_changes.dual_frequency: Use monthly output only at month boundaries; combine with daily base features via time-encoding

items.description: Replace Transformer with PCA/ICA on multi-country real rate monthly changes. Extract 2-3 principal components representing global rate level, cross-country dispersion, and rate momentum. No neural network needed.
items.reason: 269 monthly samples (188 training) is marginal for a 98K-parameter Transformer. PCA is deterministic, does not overfit, and is well-suited to small-sample regime extraction. Attempt 1-3 show neural approaches struggle with sample size.

specific_changes.method: PCA on standardized monthly real rate changes for 7 countries
specific_changes.output: PC scores as semantic features (PC1=global, PC2=dispersion)

items.description: If keeping Transformer output, drop sem_0, sem_1, sem_4 (zero MI) and keep only sem_2, sem_3 to reduce noise.
items.reason: Only 2 of 5 semantic dimensions carry meaningful MI (0.029 and 0.041). The 3 uninformative dimensions add noise that increases MAE.
